title: Investigate AI blog generation scheduling and visibility
scope: Identify where the blog article generation job is triggered (frontend-next, backend worker, or scripts)
Verify the meaning and source of the '5 days' setting and how it impacts queue polling
Ensure generation attempts are logged or surfaced so users can confirm a run was attempted
Fix scheduling or trigger behavior if the job is not running as configured
acceptance_criteria: The location and behavior of the blog generation trigger is documented or verified in code
The '5 days' setting is mapped to an explicit interval or cron and confirmed in code
Generation attempts are observable (log entry or UI/admin indicator)
If a bug exists, it is fixed so the queue polling interval matches the configured setting
risk_notes: Changing scheduling frequency could increase load or duplicate posts
Logging changes could leak too much detail if not scoped to admin/internal views
rollback_plan: Revert the scheduling or logging changes
